Authors:
Antoine Hermet, Delphine Méheust, Jérôme Mounier, Georges
Barbier, Jean-Luc Jany
Title:
Molecular systematics in the genus Mucor with special regards
to species encountered in cheese
Keywords:
Mucor . cheese . multi-locus phylogeny . morphology .
phylogenetic species
Abstract:
The genus Mucor, a member of the order Mucorales,
comprises different species encountered in cheeses. Although fungi play
a fundamental role in cheese manufacturing and ripening, the taxonomy of
many fungal species found in cheese is poorly defined; indeed, this is
the case for Mucor spp. In the present study, we assessed the
phylogenetic relationships among 70 Mucor strains, including 36 cheese
isolates, by using a five gene phylogenetic approach combined with
morphological analyses. Overall, at least six species of Mucor were
identified among the cheese isolates including a possible new taxon. The
present study also suggests that the genus Mucor comprises undescribed
taxa and needs to be properly defined.
